website_summaries.verdict: 120-count single-serve medium-roast coffee, compatible with Keurig K-cup brewers.
pros: USDA certified 100% organic brew for single-cup pod brewers
Smooth, full-bodied, and hints of citrus
Pods are composed of wood pulp lidding, a corn ring, and mesh coffee filter to be more environmentally friendly
Manufacturer gives back via community aid programs
cons: A few complaints of issues with the pods themselves – ability to compost, clogging the brewer

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be happier with something else
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the flavor and bought this for years, but in time more and more of the pods leaked. It was almost 40% of the time and I switched to a plastic pod. I get green but I also don’t have the time in the morning to strain half the coffee I make through a paper towel and clean my coffee maker out. That was the worst part. Keep looking for a better coffee. Their product has declined greatly over time
customer_reviews.author: Maverick7

customer_reviews.title: Love the variety and eco-kindness
customer_reviews.text: What I love most about these K-cups are that they are not only a delicious variety of blends, but are also compostable. French Roast - dark and smoky Breakfast Blend - medium and well balanced Organic Rainforest - medium light and full flavored Fog Chaser - medium dark with great aroma I highly recommend the variety pack if you haven’t purchased from SF bay coffee before, so you can try all of their varieties.
customer_reviews.author: HelloDanMo

customer_reviews.title: Clogs my Kuerig
customer_reviews.text: Obviously, the taste of coffee is very personal to each individual. To me, this was very strong and tasted burnt. My husband, who likes strong coffee, said it was alright. The problem is the environmentally friendly k-cups. I really liked this idea as we drink a lot of coffee, but it clogs the water output constantly. Hubby is still drinking the coffee, but will not buy again. Sorry, San Francisco Bay.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda C.

customer_reviews.title: Wasted coffee and frustrating mess to clean-up
customer_reviews.text: Have been a long-time customer of this brand, mostly French roast and Breakfast Blend. Recent orders of both have some defect in the cups; the paper separates from the plastic rim (not always, but often) expelling grounds into the cup and machine. Wasted coffee and frustrating mess to clean-up. Thoroughly cleaned machine with 2-step product purchased specifically for Keurig; no change. "Regular" k-cups have never done this. Contacted company through their site a couple of weeks ago; have heard nothing. We bought a lot of these, but the search for a replacement is on.
customer_reviews.author: David A Cheever

customer_reviews.title: What’s with new pods?!
customer_reviews.text: What’s up with new packaging? I absolutely love this coffee, But since they have switch packaging the pods seem to “explode” my in my Kreuig. Last shipment Ive received the filter part of the pod was torn on some of the pods. The top comes apart when brewing & grounds are everywhere- in my cup, all through the top of the machine. I hope this if fixed soon, I’ve not found a better coffee for my Krueger that didn’t destroy it that I had to take it back. I love that they are earth conscious!
customer_reviews.author: mailady

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is good but the cup construction has gone wayyyyy down in ...
customer_reviews.text: Coffee is good but the cup construction has gone wayyyyy down in quality. Our old ones where thick strong plastic for the support ring. These new ones are super thin and flexible. Just about every other cup is a disaster with a failed ring and grounds everywhere! So frustrating because this was our favorite coffee. I assume its because of someones failed efforts to save money but thats gonna cost in the long run with the loss of customers. Be weary of these new and “improved” cups. They suck.
customer_reviews.author: Clint T.

customer_reviews.title: Rainforest Blend is better than Fog Chaser and French Roast
customer_reviews.text: San Francisco Bay - Organic Rainforest Blend This blend (Rainforest) is by far my favorite out of all the SFB coffees. It has an amazing flavor, a decent amount of caffeine and the cost is insanely affordable for what you get. This is possibly the cheapest K-Cup I've seen but it's the best tasting or at least one of my top five. Organic - the fact that this is an "organic" blend is something that I could care less about. It's just great coffee. I figured it was worth noting.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: A family favorite..👍
customer_reviews.text: We love the flavor of this coffee. It is a medium to bold blend. Also, perfect for people who like their coffee black because the flavor is so good. I always stock up on it when family comes to visit, it's loved by all. The only negative part is the residue left on the bottom of the cup. That is the only reason for 4 stars. I love the fact that this pod is pretty close to 100% compostable. I've recently read that the company has now made the white plastic band around the top of the pod recyclable. I have not contacted the company regarding this new information, so not 100% sure of this yet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jacklin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the current quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased large boxes of this coffee brand on 2 other occassions, and was extremely happy. Now, however, I cannot say that. From the first cup that I brewed through every other cup, the coffee has a large amount of sediment in it. It also leaves behind a grit that coats the inside of a cup. I brewed the last cup in a styrofoam cup to provide a picture of the grit behind. The flavor seems to be much stronger and often has a burnt taste. I have brewed in a few different machines to ensure it was not something with my machine. Alas, it is not.
customer_reviews.author: BriB72

customer_reviews.title: Won't chance it again
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, everyday until the last two packets of 12 pods. I noticed an odd tasted, I tried to continue to drink the cup but had to dump it out. So the next morning I opened the last of my 12 packs. Tried it in a different cup, tried it black and with a little half and half. Couldn't drink it, the taste of some chemical stayed in my mouth for several hours. I have no idea what or why. I really enjoyed the coffee. But couldn't drink it after the bad taste.
customer_reviews.author: T. M.

customer_reviews.title: Regular coffee in pods
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is delicious....full robust aroma floods the room when you open a packet. I like that the pods are packaged in bags of about 12....it keeps the coffee fresh that way. You know you have a cup of coffee with this. BUT I have to stop ordering because of the sludge left in bottom of every cup, my stomach just isn't up to that. I will miss this delicious well packaged coffee...but my stomach can no longer handle the sluge in every cup. Wish there was a way to filter that out.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: This was the only coffee we used and had it ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the only coffee we used and had it automatically delivered. The company ruined its product by changing the packaging material. They described the new taste as "French roast". It is overly strong, bitter, acidic, and makes a mess of the brewing area with the drips splashing on the coffee maker and counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do you like coffee grounds?
customer_reviews.text: Then this brand is for you! I've been buying this brand, and only this brand, for years. With this new shipment, there's new packaging of the pods. No biggie. What IS a biggie, is that with the new packaging, the mesh filter refuses to stay together and you get a nice mouthful of coffee grounds. You also get to spend time before getting kids ready for school and before work cleaning out your coffee maker. This has happened with every single pod this week since I've opened the box. I'm heading to the store after work today to buy something else. Don't waste your money on this anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!! 3 broble/busted all over my Keurig & ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!! 3 broble/busted all over my Keurig & 4 each 1 busted all over friends machines. Ordered through Prime Subscribe & Save BUT no return:( ?! EXTREMELY Disappointed and so are my friends!! We'll stick to our usual k-cup brands that are returnable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marnie Mac

customer_reviews.title: GET SOME FOR YOURSELF!! NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: We have used San Francisco Bay Rainforest Coffee for about three years now and it is by far the best one-cup coffee out there. To start with, the price is just about the lowest per cup for a quality beverage. The individual cups are uniquely packaged in what I believe is the lowest environmental impact configuration possible outside of refilling your own. The mesh bottom provides a full flow for the best use of the product. the packaging of cups in sealed poly bags of about ten cups each provides for a very fresh product delivery. Overall, best price, best packaging, best product in the field.
customer_reviews.author: snack31

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping...maybe donut shop...
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: I can no longer say that this coffee is so great. My review below, which I posted a few months ago, is no longer valid. The last box I got tasty VERY bitter, and wasn't good at all. I tried contacting the company to ask if something has changed in the recipe and they didn't even bother replying. I can't tell you how much I love this coffee!!!! Everyone who's come over and tried it has also loved it. With the newer cups, they work will all kuerig Brewers, even the 2.0 versions.
customer_reviews.author: AramA

customer_reviews.title: My very favorite coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: I was used to this coffee in whole bean format from a warehouse club store, and it was the best tasting French roast coffee I have ever experienced. But I switched to a one cup brewing system, so as to not waste coffee by making a whole pot and then pouring half or more down the drain, and so had to switch to pods. Then I discovered THEY MAKE PODS!!!!! OMG!!!!! It is absolutely wonderful to be able to brew one perfect cup of French roast coffee at a time. And the value when buying 120 pods at a time is unbeatable! My very favorite coffee EVER! Don’t miss out!
customer_reviews.author: GrammaJoJo

customer_reviews.title: A Little Bitter and Lacking Hazelnut Flavor
customer_reviews.text: I expected to love this coffee after all of the glowing reviews. I also was drawn to making the purchase based on its use of more environmentally friendly packaging and the responsiveness of the company in responding to questions. Upon opening one of the pouches with a handful of K-cups I was immediately struck with a pleasing coffee aroma (as others have commented on). After brewing and drinking a mug of the unsweetened, black coffee, however, I was disappointed that there had been an imperceptible hazelnut flavor and that the coffee had left a slightly bitter aftertaste.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Spitznas

customer_reviews.title: Guilt free, high quality coffee for the Keurig machine.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I should feel entirely 'guilt free'. Regarless, SF Bay K-cups are fully biodegradable - or so the packaging says. There's certainly a whole lot less plastic to each cup. The coffee is held in by a sort of netting. Only the rim section appears to be of a plastic material (allegedly biodegradable). After use, I take scissors and dump the coffee into a container. We then distribute that used coffee around the garden. I view it as sort of a win/win. I just hope I'm not also being environmentally naive. As a French roast, it's certainly competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Coffee tastes great but I'm having problems with the pods
customer_reviews.text: Coffee tastes great but I'm having problems with the pods. It seems that plastic can't handle the heat of Keurig machine. The edges crimple up and pod breaks leaving a mess. I bought the variety pack and all of them started to crimple on edge. Out of the 120 pods, I lost about 15 due to breaking
customer_reviews.author: Andre S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality change
customer_reviews.text: When we first started getting these they were great. But the last 2 we've gotten break in the kuerig and get grounds all over. Sadly we cancelled our subscription for these even though we loved the flavor
customer_reviews.author: NanaLoc62

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I've been getting the standard K-cup Keurig (sp?) coffee from other suppliers. Half the time it's either too weak, too decaf, too weird or too expensive to try new/other flavors. I originally tried the 4 flavor 120 count package from San Francisco Bay Coffee and LOVED THEM! They came in Fog Chaser, Breakfast Blend, French Roast and Organic Rain Forest blend. Even shared them with friends for them to try. Rain Forest and Fog Chaser were my favorites, but I'm a caffeine freak and those were the top "wake up" coffees. I am now ordering the 12 flavor 120 count package from San Francisco Bay Coffee and will update then... soooo looking forward to it!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Not what it is packed up to be
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these... the concept so great, but once I used them then investigated more it wasn't quite the 'deal' it pretended to be. Only the mesh is biodegradable to the average purchaser. The rest (top and ring) are only biodegradable in an industrial plant. Who has access to one of those? The coffee itself is "ok" but nothing spectacular and worse yet the last swallow of Every Cup is wasted because of the grounds in the bottom of the cup.. not nearly as 'filtered' as other brands. Too bad, that wouldn't seem hard.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: We've been purchasing fog chaser for years now. Started off buying it on Prime Now, but it is no longer carried there so I buy through regular prime. Bought it the first time because of the quantity and price, was instantly hooked after the first cup. This is the only coffee I will drink now. I will travel with the cups and have brewed this without a Keurig as well. The commercially compostable cups are a big win, I empty out the coffee grounds into my garden or around the exterior of my house to ward off pests and then toss the remaining cup. The aroma of this coffee is second to none. I want candles made of this!
customer_reviews.author: SometimesMIMI

customer_reviews.title: I COULD SWEAR I REQUESTED DECAF FRENCH ROAST
customer_reviews.text: The nets used for these cups are great and the entire thing can be recycled. However, I could swear on my last order I asked for 120 ct DECAF French Roast but received regular French Roast. I was trying to cut down on caffeine (this has less than the Starbucks French Roast but still)... so I'm 120 cups away from switching to decaf. If you have Vanilla Flavored Almond Milk or Orgain Vanilla Bean Protein Shake they can both be used as substitutes for artificial creamers or lactose based products nicely in this brand. But I could swear I clicked Decaf French Roast.
customer_reviews.author: CLT

customer_reviews.title: MmmmMmmmMMmmmMMmmm - very good
customer_reviews.text: Comes in bags of 12, recyclable/biodegradable plastic bags of course. The coffee is indeed dark, and if you drink it black, you are a champion. I take mine with some half and half, no sugar - and it is so darn flavorful and smooth. I'm really loving this coffee - I got the decaf and caffeinated versions and there is no discernible difference in taste. They are both very solid. And the K cups works really well, leave little/no residue in my cup. And I have more peace of mind of using K-cups since they seem to be much less plastic material being used.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Ratner

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee in a pod you can buy... Environmentally friendly too!
customer_reviews.text: I just think you won't find better prices on high end well roasted coffee by a company as committed to their mission as this one. The coffee is ALWAYS delicious, the roasts are always just what they say they are. The pods are environmentally friendly, so no guilt there. But it's the coffee that's the star. This company curates an amazing array of types and roasts of coffee. These are now the office favorites and no one ever speaks about that 'ubiquitous coffee place on every corner' I've tried a lot of their blends and always been satisfied. If you're an environmentally conscious coffee lover you're in for a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Love the fully compostable cups!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed several bad reviews related to Keurig 2 and problems from late 2017 and early 2018. There was a brief period where I had some problems with broken cups. I chose to continue with the company due to environmental reasons as well as the fact that I trusted their mission statement to continue improving. Since sometime in early 2018, I've had zero problems with the cups in my Keurig 2 and I'm absolutely thrilled that I can now compost these without pulling them apart.
customer_reviews.author: The Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Bland not bold flavor
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews before buying, but I really wasn’t happy with this coffee. I do like the airtight packaging and it smells deliciously fresh and yummy. It is really not very yummy. I was expecting a rich full bodied flavor as some described but found it to be a bit dull. It is not bitter which it good but it is not rich and flavorful.Bland is probably the best way I can describe it. I like a good bold smooth coffee. This coffee is smooth but falls flat.
customer_reviews.author: NikiTX

customer_reviews.title: A Good Cup of Joe
customer_reviews.text: Donut Shop Blend is a good cup of coffee; period. My employer stocks the company beverage stations with several coffee and tea choices. This is my favorite. Not too strong; makes a perfect cup of morning coffee. That is significant to me because I've never been a heavy coffee drinker. It's important to me that coffee doesn't bite my tongue off first thing in the morning' and that the flavor is agreeable. It's gentle on my stomach, so I can have a second cup without risking heartburn. The product arrived intact, well packaged. Definitely a product to order over and over.
customer_reviews.author: NW Granny

customer_reviews.title: Bottom of “kcup” rips in machine.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same quality that I loved when I bought it at Costco. Fabric bottom of cup rips and brewed coffee is full of grounds. I loved this product because it has less waste but not happy with this batch. UPDATE: Months later I bought 2 cases after several good ones from Costco and now I feel that either the ‘seconds’ are being sold on Amazon or the quality has suffered and that’s why Costco doesn’t sell anymore. I won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: toothfairy

customer_reviews.title: It's growing on me. To be honest, I ...
customer_reviews.text: It's growing on me. To be honest, I was expecting a lighter roast coffee but what I got was more of a medium roast. It's got an interesting "woody/earthy" flavor but it's not bitter. It's much stronger than the Green Mountain Breakfast blend and it's even a tad stronger than the San Francisco Bay Gourmet Blend, which is a little more smooth. But I'm enjoying this coffee more and more and I'll probably continue buying it.
customer_reviews.author: MoLarryCurly

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, inconsistent pod quality of late
customer_reviews.text: I think this is one of the very best French roasts out there in k-cup form. I have not had the experience of others who think it’s weak. I think there have been some bad batches through their QA/QC process. I purchased a box of 120 cups and had several that would rupture on the side and spew grounds all over my keurig. Then I bought a couple boxes of 80ct and I’ve yet to have a single pod do that. The flavor has been consistent though, and it’s great. If you need stronger coffee than this you might as well cut the pod open and chew the insides.
customer_reviews.author: No N Brett

customer_reviews.title: Declining Quality?
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years as loyal customers, I've fallen out of love with this coffee. This last batch of coffee had defective pods which made a mess in my Keurig and grinds in the bottom of my cup. After several mornings I noticed the coffee had a bitter taste. That won't work. They used to pack a plastic container along with the bags as these pods need to be stored in a tight container. They did away with that. Lastly, It used to be available as a subscription - that was eliminated. They're cutting corners and getting careless with quality control. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Paperwhite Rider

customer_reviews.title: A total surprise!  The great kind.
customer_reviews.text: My complicated coffee machine broke down during all the self isolation...and I am a serious drinker of coffee. In a pinch, I took the little "K" brand coffeemaker out of our camper and was using it with their pods...which always always required taking a paper clip to clean out grounds. So..I tried out YOUR product. What luck! The coffee is excellent and the design of your "pods" prevented grounds from escaping. My husband thought I was using the complicated machine!!! I highly recommend your product. Thanks and stay safe.m
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Fog Chaser is best coffe known to me. We love it here in our house. I especially like that the cups are In sealed bags to help keep them fresh (about ten cups per stay fresh recyclable bag). This helps keep large orders fresh till they are all used. The manufacturer though of everything. The delivery was fast and price was right. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jimthe5th

customer_reviews.title: Donut shop changed flavor/strength?!
customer_reviews.text: I subscribe and save the donut shop blend and it suddenly changed to a light roast instead of medium?! (The listing itself says light, the subscription and old packaging says medium, the actual taste/flavor is completely different now too). I now have 120 k-cups of garbage that tastes like watered down cheap/bad coffee. Super upset and canceling my subscription. Update: Amazon was kind enough to refund my order, but I still stand by my review. SFB changed the coffee roast/flavor/etc and I do not recommend Donut Shop blend anymore!
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious - inexpensive - ecologically sound - what else are you looking for???
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as any other San Francisco Bay coffee pod I've tried. This design minimizes waste and ecological impact, as it does not include the large plastic "cup" around the lower half of the pod - instead a mesh filter firmly holds the coffee in place. The coffee tastes great, and the price really can't be beat. Even the packaging the pods come in is primarily biodegradable/recyclable. I do recommend that you have some zip-lock bags handy - once you breach the smaller bags containing the pods, you'll want to put the pods you haven't used yet in the zip-lock to keep them fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfgang Rumpf

customer_reviews.title: Loooove this coffee, it's so smooth and wonderful deep taste.
customer_reviews.text: This is my very favorite coffee out of the scores, perhaps hundreds I have tried. It's consistent, has a refreshing, full taste for any time, evening or morning. It has never given me that disgusting feeling that my breath smells of it, doesn't give me jitters, perks me up, and I think it smells better than anything else I've ever brewed, kcup, pour over, percolator, or brew basket. I am so grateful for the first time I tried this. I'll drink something else when out of the house, but at home, except for the occasional try of a whim or a gift, I always look forward to my next cup of this.
customer_reviews.author: Call 'em as I see 'em

customer_reviews.title: Less Waste
customer_reviews.text: I like SF Bay coffee pods. They provide for less waste than typical pods and the pod material is biodegradable. The coffee flavor and aroma is great. The pods come in airtight storage bags of about 20 pods. Once the bag is open, the pods are exposed to air and the fabric bag structure does not provide as much protection as the typical all plastic pod. However, I use the pods quickly enough that I don't find this to be a big problem. You could store them in an airtight container after opening the bag - I don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Randy W. Dipner

customer_reviews.title: Not household compostable, potentially dangerous webbing
customer_reviews.text: Coffee taste isn't great, I prefer some of the other combo packs I've purchased. However I am disappointed that these are not really compostable, unless you personally have an "industrial compost" at your disposal this is not really helpful. Instead I find the normal kcup shape to be easier to empty and compost myself. Additionally the netting portion that holds the coffee is a plastic filament webbing, I imagine this is more harmful out in the environment than a cup.
customer_reviews.author: The Parrot University

customer_reviews.title: Be the envy of your household or workplace with this blend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand and flavor. Now I'll be the envy of all my coworkers as drink this amazing blend. Maybe I'll even be popular when they want to come by and inquire about the aromatic smells coming from my cube, which is fresh and strong. They'll want to run back and get their mugs to try the rich bold flavor, and marvel at the lack of an entire plastic cup and mesh filter for less disposal and greater decomposition. Try this brand at home or work and be "that person" with this great coffee. :-P Seriously though, it is really good, and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest L. Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: Best. Coffee. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite coffee in the world! We go through a case a week. I drink a lot of coffee and I have literally tracked down my postman on a Saturday after he left a note to redeliver the coffee on Monday. LoL. The fresh bags are awesome. The kids love to take turns getting the first sniff of the newly opened bag. Thanks SF Bay Co for making such amazing stuff! I always get the French Roast. If they are out, I’ll grab Fog Chaser. Those are the two I go to.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Gonsales

customer_reviews.title: Grounds in my coffee is not acceptable!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these in the past for my Keurig and was very pleased with the flavor and the fact that they were not plastic cups. However this batch was awful. Many of them broke or split when used. It appears the paper covering on the top was not secure. I often had grounds in my cup of coffee. I cleaned my Keurig, hoping to get rid of the grounds that might be left. It is one-cup Keurig and I must have put at least 20 cups of water through it and still had grounds. I will not buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Hommer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Keurig 2.0 400
customer_reviews.text: My problem is not whether the Keurig 2.0 400 recognizes the pod. The socket where the pod is placed for brewing is too small or the pod is too big. I requested a refund and was told not to return the coffee so I asked that SF Bay send something in pods that will fit. I receive another box of the same today. WTF No return, no refund. SFB gave me a second box of 120 unusable pods. WTF
customer_reviews.author: B. Aiton

customer_reviews.title: Love having a one cup coffee that is virtually trash free
customer_reviews.text: i love my Keurig and the convenience of making coffee a cup at a time but hate creating more trash for the landfill. This coffee is not only really tasty but the packaging is almost totally biodegradable. this particular version of the San Francisco coffees is not overly bold, never bitter but has a good punch. i cannot do "light roast" coffee but am not always up for the very bold flavor of their Fogg Chaser. this is a good medium roast option. (although if you like a bold coffee, i would suggest the fogg chaser!!)
customer_reviews.author: A. Whelchel

customer_reviews.title: If you can use your Keurig
customer_reviews.text: My Keurig is not making a full cup of coffee with these pods. Why is that. it did at first but not now??? The paper is very thick. I have to run water in it to make a full cup. What is the problem? Have you had this issue with others?
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Flavorful, Fresh Cup of Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coffee I've ever tasted! I enjoy strong coffee, but it must have a bold flavor as well. I use to drink 8 O'Clock Columbian coffee, but when I had my first cup of San Francisco Columbian, I knew I would switch. I also like that they are divided into bags for freshness, and they are made of biodegradable mesh instead of the larger plastic cups. It is a little stronger than 8 O'Clock, but definitely has more flavor. This one is a winner!
customer_reviews.author: kimberly carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Pods falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this San Francisco Bay Fog Chaser coffee pods for years and really love the coffee, but my last order, delivered last week, has a major problem. 2 out of 3 pods come apart in the Keurig and brew grounds in to my cup!! The pod portion is pulling away from the rim when the water hits it. My cup is full of grounds. Since I've already gone through a few bags, .there is probably no return, but I love the coffee, when the pod works!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Customer

customer_reviews.title: Getting better
customer_reviews.text: My old review is below. I decided to give these another chance and I’m glad I did because they’ve improved a lot! In the last 2 boxes I haven’t had a single pod fall apart. The coffee tastes great, these are easy to use, and they’re mostly biodegradable! Updated to 5 stars! I used to love these but the quality has gone downhill. The pods are coming apart and causing a huge mess in my Keurig with coffee grounds getting everywhere. It seems to happen about a quarter of the time now. Prior to this box, I'd never had this problem. I'm really disappointed that I'll have to find a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Third time I've ordered and I don't drink that much coffee. But I am a coffee snob and this has the right amount of robust flavor. I like a deep, rich taste without being over-the-top (espresso itself, for me) and this fits the bill. Quality. But don't put the expended pods in your compost pile and expect them to decompose. It won't happen. Other than that, this is a great product and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Coy

customer_reviews.title: Very good K-cup, environmentally friendly package, economical.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good blend- slightly robust but not bitter. Price is good in this quantity. As with all of the SF Bay OneCups, it is an environmentally friendly K-cup which does not have the plastic cup- it doesn't need it. It comes in plastic bags which are sealed and air tight- I think they are not permeable to the coffee flavor. Once the bag is opened the 10 K-Cups need to be stored in an airtight container, or remain in the bag with it cli[[ed shut. No problem- we get used to that and they seem to retian their freshness. Nice to have an environmentally friendly K-Cup!
customer_reviews.author: R. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Delicious without plastic waste
customer_reviews.text: What is there to dislike about this coffee? It has a good strong flavor that you expect from a French Roast without being overly bitter. It can stand up to sugar and/or milk without losing it’s coffee flavor. And it doesn’t have the typical plastic waste of Keurig coffees so you don’t have to feel guilty about drinking it. I recommend that you give it a try. My daughter and I both love it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Paul

customer_reviews.title: This coffeee is GOOD, real GOOD
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been looking for a new coffee for a long time. I have tried so many usually to wake up to a text that says “nice try but coffe is thumbs down” I really wanted to switch to organic coffee so after reading lots of reviews I ordered this brand. My husband saw the new coffee the night before and said “not another one to try, I really like my Starbucks” I told him to give it a chance and the next morning I woke up to a text that said “this coffee is GOOD, real GOOD” excited to have found a new coffee and love that its organic!!!
customer_reviews.author: LexiAlby

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Curse you SF Bay Coffee. You have given me a life-long habit. This is a great roast, neither too dark nor too light. What cemented my loyalty was the additional feature of the pod being compostable. I first tried SF Bay for that reason then realized it is one of the best-tasting coffees out there. I must have saved a thousand $ by not buying a cup of over-priced coffee from Starbuck's.
customer_reviews.author: B. Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and no more plastic waste!
customer_reviews.text: I love a dark roast with lots of flavor- the French Roast K Cups from SF Bay Coffee is yum! I use 2 on the single setting on my Keurig. 12 (I think) “cups” are packaged in airtight bags so you aren’t opening all at once. It’s great especially because these aren’t like the normal plastic K cups- so you can drink your yummy coffee and feel good about the biodegradable packaging :)
customer_reviews.author: lovecustomerservice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deep dark flavorful
customer_reviews.text: New favorite coffee. It is rich, deep, and flavorful. I have a Keurig and I have found very few pods provide the deep coffee house flavor I prefer. SF French Roast does it! The price from Amazon is great. I have not composted yet but have given the used pods to others who do with no complaints. These are packaged with a few in a package which is perfect. I have purchased others which were individually packaged which was NOT ideal. If it matters to you, check first.
customer_reviews.author: Debrenee Fisher McGee

customer_reviews.title: So fresh and biodegradable cup is a plus
customer_reviews.text: This coffee has spoiled me for other brands that come in plastic k-cups. So fresh!! Love that they are compostable and not plastic. My favorite is French Roast which is fresh, sturdy and flavorful. I have to admit that I can't drink coffee black. I need a flavored creamer, but I still appreciate the boldness and flavor of this coffee. I keep it in sealed mason jars.
customer_reviews.author: Happy girl

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Pods, coffee is not bitter and low acidity
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite coffee pods. The coffee is the right roast for me. Medium bold. Low acidic levels make this ideal as well. They are almost 100 percent biodegradable. When my coffee gets cold it doesn't get bitter tasting like other coffees like pike place roast which I would say is a similar blend and roast of coffee. This is my number one coffee and I would suggest to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Simila

customer_reviews.title: Both thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This coffee has the Seattle/Northwest flavor (like Starbucks). I bought it as the cups have less plastic. Now I’m cutting the top and extracting the grounds for my worm farm. (They love them.) This was a switch from the milder Green Mountain Breakfast Blend so it took a little getting used to but I look forward to the flavor now and I feel better about tossing less plastic in the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Miller

customer_reviews.title: K-cups ripping part - coffee grinds everywhere
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered this product for a long time and loved it. However, our last shipment has had multiple "exploding" K-cups in it and we're left with a coffee cup full of grounds. Every time we have to do a major cleanup of the machine. We are using several other brands of K-cups with no issues, so I don't think it's the fault of the Keurig. We still have seven packs left, but are not going to use them and we're past our allotted time to return. I'm sorry about this as we really do like this brand. We won't be ordering this again - at least until I hear this issue is taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri S

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, socially and environmentally responsible.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for years and love the Fogchaser the best. It has a bold flavor that can stand up to a 10 oz cup. What I love even more than the flavor is the decomposable mesh cups. I dont know why more companies dont use these. I have turned many people on to this coffee because of the flavor and they are fare trade and environmental responsible. All that and a great cup of coffee. I was not a fan of their French roast but the breakfast blend was good.
customer_reviews.author: BeWache57

customer_reviews.title: SERIOUS QUALITY CONTROL PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: Really upset with the quality of these pods! At least 12-15% of them are not sealed properly so they end up exploding and coffee grounds go everywhere in the Keurig, my cup, the counter - UGH!! Love the idea that they are paper, as supposedly better for the environment but serious quality control issues - will NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DeLaney

customer_reviews.title: Once a favorite, not anymore!
customer_reviews.text: For a good long while this WAS my favorite coffee blend. However, my last delivery of this coffee has not been the same. With 5 packages remaining suddenly the taste is very off-putting & bitter. With a terrible aftertaste. I’m really not sure what happened but I’m very disappointed to say the least. And unfortunately, it’s too late to return it. Buyers beware!!
customer_reviews.author: Shoefanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting Dark roast, excellent value for the money, stays fresh
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this espresso roast coffee, it smells fantastic when you open it. He drinks about 5 cups a day and it always smells great. This is by far the best value for money and taste for coffee to use in a Keurig . I have it on monthly subscribe and save, so the value is even better. If you like a strong cup of coffee you will not be disappointed. If you prefer a lighter blend I would try one of their other roasts.
customer_reviews.author: rhymswithbanana

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Okay I LOVE these because they don't have the plastic BUT they are totally hit or miss!! I will get a cup, about 1 per bag that is SO bitter and burnt that you can't even drink it. I'm definitely going back to the other brand with the plastic (not the K brand but the others on here with the good deal). I do however, reuse the cups for succulent propagation so they aren't going in the landfill. The flavor of these is fairly decent and I do like that they are organic.
customer_reviews.author: LittleEmeraldThumbonEtsy

customer_reviews.title: The best of both worlds...
customer_reviews.text: We have this on a subscription that comes regularly. It's got a very smooth rich flavor and comes in compostable pods in compostable bags. I'm picky about my Java and trying to be environmentally conscious... This coffee company offers me the convenience of pods, organically sourced, exceptional coffee and the environmentally responsible alternative that I demand. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MGMoore

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: When I got this I was impressed with the micro-bags of ecopods that we’re in them. It let me open a bag and keep the rest of them closed for the rest of the time. I haven’t had any problems with this ecopod with my keurig machine either, everything has gone smooth and there hasn’t been a problem with interaction with the keurig machine. I used this pod three times so far, and have t had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Situational Awareness

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee and to pods and bags are biodegradable,  latest horrible  delivery
customer_reviews.text: I hate throwing out all those plastic pods. These pods are the perfect solution. Plus the coffee and delicious. Love this coffee, i have a monthly subscription. i just looked at my latest delivery (last night) and it said it was handed directly to someone in my household. That is an outright LIE. It was delivered and 7:50PM sitting on my front steps in the pouring rain. If my ring device did not alert me it would have been outside in the rain all night.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Changes to the packaging do not allow a full cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee was one of my favorites! My last order was back in August, in my previous order they mentioned changing the materials. They did, and now I can no longer use them in my coffee pot. Whatever the material now is, it doesn't allow the coffee to come through and when I try to make a large cup I end up with just an inch of coffee in my cup. Not sure if Amazon read these comments, but if they do I'd like to make arrangements to return what I have left. So disappointed that I need to find a new coffee.
customer_reviews.author: A. Vinci

customer_reviews.title: Delicious decaf...
customer_reviews.text: This is THE best decaf I have ever had in the Keurig. And it is compostable. The flavor is deep and dark requiring me to use a bit of lightener. The price is right and the taste absolutely perfect. Two in house and we both agree. One loves it with no lightener. The price is excellent. I must say that I have been drinking SFBay coffee bought at Costco for years and have always loved it. I also have the non decaf given as a gift directly from Costco and it cost $35 for 100 cups. Also excellent taste, deep, rich, dark.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen M. Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee, best price, less plastic waste for the environment
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad that the coffee i like the most is also the best for the environment (other K Cups are fully surrounded with plastic while these are not. These come in separate bags for 10 servings, so you open a bag of 10 and I put them into a sealed tupperware container to keep them fresh. Then about 10 days later I pull out the next bag. Very handy and they taste great.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B

customer_reviews.title: Good taste, but problem with the packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Good taste, but problem with the packaging. These capsules only have a hard plastic rim, the rest of the container is soft coffee filter material. I find that in my machine (admittedly a cheap Faberware unit from Walmart) quite often the capsule is not punctured normally. The unit steams, but no coffee is brewed. I tried punching a little hole with a sharp knife, but that causes coffee grains to overflow during brewing. I now take the precaution of pressing down the puncture lever a couple of times, then open up the capsule tray to make sure that a hole has been punched. Then press start - OK.
customer_reviews.author: Roy D.

customer_reviews.title: Not For My Tastebuds
customer_reviews.text: Everyone has different tastes, however this coffee was very bitter even with my normal splash of whole milk added in. I drank it out of a Keurig 2.0 brewer with filtered water from our fridge. I’ll admit it does come very fresh and well packaged, but the packaging and item description is misleading in that it promotes these as being completely compostable but this is only true for industrial composting operations and not your (likely more common) household compost bins. I’ll be trying other flavors, but forever in search of the perfect cup of Joe... *sigh*.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J.

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly and great flavor
customer_reviews.text: Just received this variety box. Ibe been drinking the Rainforest blend for a couple of weeks and absolutely love it so I wanted to try the other coffees. I have Breakfast blend in my cup right now and, though not as strong as the rainforest, it has a nice light taste and is very aromatic. I LOVE that the 'cups' are eco friendly as well as the packaging. I give my plants a coffee ground boost every week and these are easy to cut open to release the grounds. Overall, I've been extremely pleased with this product, customer service, and the company's dedication to a great cup of coffee and the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey R.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what happened,have been buying Fog Chaser for years,last case of 120 is awful, I am halfway thru and have to cut them open and pour into a reusable insert. They clog,some split open,also coffee is really bitter this batch. Other k-cups work fine. Won’t buy again
customer_reviews.author: Mjb

customer_reviews.title: Good & Eco-Friendly, but has a lot of Sediment
customer_reviews.text: The coffee and packaging is high quality. Instead of an entirely plastic cup these are a composed of a rigid ring, paper lid, and filtering "pouch" holding the coffee grounds. This reduces the environmental cost of using a Keurig. The box contains several smaller airtight "compostable" plastic bags, you'll need to plan for airtight storage for the 8-10 servings inside. The only downside (and the reason for the 4 star review) is that the filter lets a lot of particulate through, similar to the amount you'd get from a french press. This makes the bottom of the cup unpleasant to drink and sometimes causes me some intestinal distress.
customer_reviews.author: Unamanic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This was my second order of this product. My main dislike is that the brewed coffee leaves rings inside the coffee cup. I called the company and was told this was to be expected. I prefer a Nespresso coffee which I have an older pro model at home and may switch to a newer Nespresso for its flavor and taste. I believe it to be better than Keurig. But delivery and value was very good.
customer_reviews.author: KenS

customer_reviews.title: Good combination of flavors
customer_reviews.text: Good combination of flavors. Love that it helps the environment because it's not plastic, Only complaint is that when you use in the k Pack machine the thing that comes down to puncture the top of the pack sometimes does not puncture a hole in it it just scratches the surface because it's more of a paper cover top not easy to puncture through like the original k Pack cups. It still works though I just have to open the place with the coffee pack in it after I have it punctured to make sure it did in fact go through otherwise I'll just have water. The flavors are great! Good coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Harmony A.Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Big flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Keurig coffee maker. But I didn't like putting all that plastic into the environment. These biodegradable pods give you all the convenience of a k-cup with none of the plastic. But most importantly, they taste fantastic! Rich, full taste, not bitter. They do leave some residue in your cup, but that's a small price to pay in exchange for helping the environment. Recommend highly!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great decaf coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great decaf coffee. It doesn't taste like most decaf blends! The french roast is full bodied and smooth without an after bite. The new pods are great. They don't cause me any problems with my Kuerig but I agree with some of reviews...the coffee is so finely ground that you do get a skim of fine grounds across the top of the coffee and some in the bottom of the cup. I can put up with that because of the flavor! I'm going to buy it again. I love the strong full bodied flavor that you don't normally get in decaf coffee blends.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this espresso for a long time now and every time it was perfect. However, they must have cut the amount of coffee in each pouch. I am so disappointed, it tastes nothing like it used to. And it was not just an isolated pouch. I tried several pouches, all the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Monika H. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Damaged coffee pods - where is quality control before these are packaged and shipped?
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee and have it as a regular subscription. But for some reason, eight of the ten coffee pods in this particular bag were damaged. It’s like someone pressed on the top too hard and the seam was ripped, spilling coffee everywhere and emptying out several of them. The only thing worse that wasted food or money is wasted coffee. :(
customer_reviews.author: TrishTrish

customer_reviews.title: but since my house now smells like the coffee with 11 pods sitting in my kcups ...
customer_reviews.text: The kcups are not the sealed kcups I'm accustomed to. They actually have a filtered bottom that is open to the air, not encased by plastic. The pods are sealed in a vac-fresh pack of 12 (i believe), but once opened, I worry about the freshness of the coffee. The coffee quality is delicious, especially for decaf, but since my house now smells like the coffee with 11 pods sitting in my kcups tray waiting to be brewed, I will have to wait and see how it tastes after being exposed to air for a few weeks. I will update my review later to if it truly doesn't effect the taste. These kcups do fit in my Keurig without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Long

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Only suggestion would be for them to be in resealable bags. The pods are bagged in 10's and once you open them the bags are not resealable. It makes it hard to store since these are not the typical plastic cups with full seal. As far as the coffee itself, it is a good balanced Columbian that I will definitely be ordering again
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is quality coffee and environmentally friendly packaging.
customer_reviews.text: These coffee pods are great. The French roast has the flavor and boldness that I expect in a French roast. I like that the pods aren’t the typical plastic cups but a more environmentally friendly material. The bags the pods come in are compostable. The price is unbeatable for coffee of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: All of the comments about the taste are true. Tastes stale and odor is terrible and leaves dirty container after one brew. I bought them as they were compostable but it turns out the plastic rim decomposes very slowly. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: VirginiaS

customer_reviews.title: Which is which?
customer_reviews.text: This order includes 4 different coffee blends. They are packaged in the usual air tight sacks that is standard with San Francisco bay coffee. This is good because it keeps the coffee fresh. In this case, however, it is also a problem because the sacks are not labeled. This means you have to try to make out which blend is in which sack. You ought to put a label on the outside of the sack when you are including more than one blend in a box.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: the flavor isn’t great.
customer_reviews.text: We typically buy coffee in bulk from Costco but decided to give this a try. We aren’t coffee snobs by any means but this coffee is slightly below average. My two biggest complaints is the amount of grounds that are always in my coffee cup and he fact that the pods need to be kept in a sealed bag to protect the flavor. Speaking of flavor, the flavor isn’t great.
customer_reviews.author: Ally F

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee
customer_reviews.text: I really like the full flavor of this coffee. It's hard to find dark roasted decaf, but this product delivers that. I also like the fact that the hot water doesn't run through plastic before it hits my cup. However, I am disappointed in my latest shipment because there were several pods that were busted open, leaving loose grounds everywhere. This is NOT inexpensive coffee, in my opinion, so each pod is important! Hopefully future product will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the French Roast lovers
customer_reviews.text: Did not intend to order the french roast, but I am surviving. It is a heavy, rich decaf, very finely ground which has led to a few errant pieces of bean in my coffee cup after brewing. Not nearly enough to concern me or stop use. I will reorder, though maybe a different variety. I don't particularly enjoy french roast but can recognize and enjoy the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Enailia

customer_reviews.title: This is Really Good Decaf!
customer_reviews.text: Most decafs have a slightly “thin” taste to me, but this coffee is a delight. It’s flavor is rich and the texture is almost “chewable” (and that’s a good thing to me). When I had to give up caffeine due to health, it took quite a while to find one that has the bold and dark taste I prefer. Really do like the compostable pods it comes in. Makes much more sense than all the plastic pods we’ve used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: mathman47

customer_reviews.title: Good Decaf!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this coffee! I love the pods and how they work in my coffeemaker. I ordered from another company that had the plastic pods and I must have thrown away at least 10 pods because the needle didn't pierce the pod and the coffee didn't run through correctly. These pods though are perfect to use!!! The coffee taste fresh every time because of the unique packaging they use. I'm will be ordering again and again. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kerecman

customer_reviews.title: REALLY GOOD COFFEE AND SAFE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT, TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Keurig pods many years ago, in part because of taste and mostly because San Francisco Bay pods are safe for the environment which is a definite plus. I have always been satisfied with the different varieties that I have tried however I keep coming back to Fog Chaser.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Kunin

customer_reviews.title: Clogging Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have been order this product almost 4 years ! My wife love it. She doesn't want other brands. Now she complained about the coffee clogging coffee machine! First I tought the coffee machine problems turn out no problems and try different coffee brand and work well !! I would like San Francisco bay company to look back their products !! I like the idea but you need to check your products before you selling to customers.
customer_reviews.author: Dps

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, biodegradable K-cups
customer_reviews.text: I love San Fransisco Bay K-cups! I always feel so bad using the normal plastic ones, but these are biodegradable. I legitimately go out of my way to buy this brand. I've bought big boxes of the French Roast and Rainforest, and those are good. I've also had the Fog Chaser, but that one was a bit acidic for my stomach (had an ulcer a while ago).
customer_reviews.author: MSMooring

customer_reviews.title: Still I like this brand so I might try again
customer_reviews.text: This batch of SF bay (I've had many) is slightly dry. The pot can just force the water through them, or sometimes I have to do a second cycle to get a full cup. maybe ditching the plastic "cup" on the fiter has a cost. That cost being freshness. Still I like this brand so I might try again. but maybe not...
customer_reviews.author: innovadata

customer_reviews.title: Fresh and bold taste
customer_reviews.text: We found this coffee during our family quarantine time and it has become our go to in the Keurig. Great taste and we appreciate the packaging and commitment to sustainability.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Shupp Menet

customer_reviews.title: Great Bold K-cup Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I used to like the Original Donut Shop k-cup, but eventually me and my father felt it was getting water downed and the boldness of the coffee was gone. After searching for the next k-cup brand, I decided to try out the San Francisco k-cup. More "greenier" than the average k-cup and also has a wide variety of coffee flavor. The coffee flavor is not weak and it has a bold coffee flavor that is just right for medium roast coffee. After several years of using this product, I never used any other k-cup brand for home use. My personal favorites is Fog Chasers and Espresso Roast.
customer_reviews.author: LiquidFire

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is great coffee. I do not like dark roast. These are perfect and have a nice, rich coffee flavor without the bitterness. I like that the pods use less plastic instead of the k-cups made by Keurig. This is less expensive than buying from a Wharehouse store and a whole lot cheaper than the coffe I have purchased from retail and grocery stores. The cups come packaged in sealed, biodegradable plastic pouches. This keeps the cups fresh. I open the packages as needed. I have an early model Keurig coffee maching and these works just as well if not better than the original k-cups. This is also a subscribe and save item so you can save even more.
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

product_meta.title: SF Bay Coffee Organic Rainforest Blend 120 Ct Medium Roast Compostable Coffee Pods, K Cup Compatible including Keurig 2.0 (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Organic Rainforest BlendAre you looking for delicious, gourmet coffee available in a wide selection and at great value? Then "San Francisco Bay Coffee" Is for you! We've developed a line of unique custom blends, exotic regional coffees, and single estate coffees available in 12 ounce and 2 pound bags. All are environmentally and socially responsible gourmet coffee offered at the best possible prices. We stand for premium, sustainable, direct Trade coffee at prices you'll love. We like to say our products are grown for good. Our community aid Program has restored thousands of acres of rainforest by farming only with shade grown farms, and planted our own coffee on our own organic farms. Our one Cup single serve coffees are compatible with Keurig K-Cup brewers and other brands of single serve brewers. Our reputation reflects on us as a family. As such, your satisfaction is Our top priority, and we stand firmly behind the quality of all of our products. If you’re not happy with your purchase for any reason, we will make it right.
feature_bullets: ORGANIC RAINFOREST BLEND: This USDA certified organic blend is a medium roast full-bodied coffee with notes of sweet berry and dark chocolate. Certified Organic by CCOF.
KEURIG COMPATIBLE: Designed for use with K cup style single serve brewers including Keurig 2.0. SF Bay Coffee is not affiliated with Keurig Green Mountain.
ECO-FRIENDLY, COMMERCIALLY COMPOSTABLE: OneCup pods, including the outer bag and one-way coffee valve, are made from plant-based materials and are certified fully commercially compostable by BPI.

Packaging: Due to the current circumstances and material supplier constraints, the packaging may vary. The product ingredients, roast, amount of coffee, etc. have not changed and the product quality is the same

SF BAY COFFEE is a family owned, American made company with a rich tradition. Our reputation reflects on us as a family so if you're ever not happy with your purchase, call us at 1(800) 829-1300 and we'll make it right.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
